alert.note: Alert for Butte; Clark (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:41PM MDT until May 26 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Butte County in southeastern Idaho... Southwestern Clark County in southeastern Idaho... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimates 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Howe, Howe Peak, and Saddle Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately. Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
